doc:
Glynn Turman https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glynn_Turman 0 Glynn Russell Turman (born January 31, 1947) is an American stage, television, and film actor as well as a writer, director, and producer. Turman is known for his roles as Lew Miles on the prime-time soap opera Peyton Place (1968–69), high school student Leroy "Preach" Jackson in the 1975 coming-of-age film Cooley High, math professor and retired Army colonel Bradford Taylor on the NBC sitcom A Different World (1988–93), and fictional Baltimore mayor Clarence Royce on the HBO drama series The Wire. He recently portrayed Jeremiah Kaan on the Showtime series House of Lies. Glynn_Russell_Turman ( born January_31_,_1947 ) is an_American_stage , television , and film_actor as_well_as a_writer , director , and producer . Turman is_known for his_roles as Lew_Miles on the_prime-time_soap_opera_Peyton_Place_(_1968 – 69_) , high_school_student_Leroy_"_Preach_"_Jackson in the_1975_coming-of-age_film_Cooley_High , math_professor and retired Army_colonel_Bradford_Taylor on the_NBC_sitcom_A_Different_World_(_1988 – 93_) , and fictional_Baltimore_mayor_Clarence_Royce on the_HBO_drama_series The_Wire . He recently portrayed Jeremiah_Kaan on the_Showtime_series_House of Lies .
